author: Special Correspondent
text:
Three new exam centres have been sanctioned by the School Education Department for conduct of SSLC and Plus Two public exams this year.

One centre each in Erode and Gobi educational districts have been sanctioned for Plus Two and one centre in Erode educational district for SSLC, according to official sources.

Number of centres

The number of centres will increase to 75 for Plus Two with the new addition.

Increased

Likewise, for SSLC, the number of centres will be 99 this year from 98 last year.

A few new centres are sanctioned every year by the Education Department based on the student strength in the schools. The new centres are usually sanctioned for private schools.

In 2014, however, nine new centres were sanctioned for Plus

Two of the, three were in Gobichettipalayam and six in Erode educational district.

Flying

squads

The increase in the centres would mean enhancement in the strength of teachers to be drawn for membership in the flying squads, sources said.
title: Three new centres sanctioned for Plus Two, SSLC exams
